description: TPO 127 T10 1 x Oak reduce to previous points (approx 2m), remove epicormic shoots from trunk and main branches.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.  Therefore, if applicable, it is advisable to consult your tree surgeon / consultant to agree an acceptable time for carrying out the approved works.

The tree to be pruned shall be crown reduced by cutting back to 25-50 mm beyond previous points (approx 2m). Crown reduction shall not be construed as 'lopping' or 'topping' and shall result in a tree of typical form for the species and of balanced appearance.
The previous pruning points / pollard heads shall be left intact and an appropriate number of live branches (which can be shortened) shall be left so that a natural-looking crown results.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained in BS 3998:2010 'Tree work - Recommendations'. Climbing irons or 'spikes' shall not be used during the execution of the work.
In order to protect health of the tree and the visual amenity of the area.
